title: Personal Car Communicator
text:
A Personal Car Communicator (PCC) is a system of protection in a <a href="key%20fob">key fob</a> developed by <a href="Volvo%20Cars">Volvo</a>.
The Personal Car Communicator was first introduced by the company in the new <a href="Volvo%20S80">S80</a> sedan for model year 2007. The personal car communicator uses a two-way radio communicator, allowing the vehicle owner to check such security items as the locking status of the vehicle. Most notable is the ability of a heart beat monitor that checks if someone is left inside the car.
